summary: Several federal agencies used "open source" data—social media posts and other publicly available information—to obtain information about the potential for violence at the U.S. Capitol prior to January 6, 2021. Agencies developed reports for situational awareness based on open source data, which indicated that Groups may attack the Capitol or Congress Extremist groups may commit or incite violence Groups may be armed or Violence was...
title: Capitol Attack: Federal Agencies' Use of Open Source Data and Related Threat Products Prior to January 6, 2021
